sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis declares no one can be marginalized as he presides over Palm Sunday Mass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After tornadoes killed 26 in the U.S., the cleanup begins.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The cost of constructing a fence in Finland at the Russian border is estimated to run into hundreds of millions of euros and could take around three to four years to be finished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The work is underway as the country moves a step closer towards joining NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Between 130 and 260 kilometres of partial fencing are to be built along a front line that's more than 1,300 kilometers long.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Pope Francis has presided over Palm Sunday Mass a day after leaving hospital due to bronchitis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In his homily he defended the abandoned of the world, saying no one can be marginalized.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Palm Sunday opens a heavy schedule of Holy Week appointments for Francis. He received antibiotics administered intravenously during his three-day stay in hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After a monster storm system with multiple tornadoes tore through the South and Midwest states in the US on Friday, the big cleanup has begun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At least 26 people were killed as homes were shredded and shopping centers demolished.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Right now for me it's just to clean up what I can and then get this cleared and then try to see who else I can help and what I can do to help and then see about the school and what we can do to get that back in order.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Around 400,000 people in five states lost their electricity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The governor of Arkansas has declared a state of emergency, activating statewide assistance and help from the National Guard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The storm happened a week after tornadoes ripped through Mississippi, killing 26.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Humanity is about to take one step closer to returning to this place, the moon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Because on April 3rd, NASA will announce the names of the three Americans and one Canadian who will launch on a lunar mission called Artemis II next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In 2024, they will fly around the moon and become the first humans to see this place up close in 50 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They'll also be the first humans to fly in the new Orion spacecraft, which completed an uncrewed automatic mission last year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So let's talk you through the Artemis II mission these astronauts will undertake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Soon after launch on an SLS rocket from NASA's Kennedy Space Center in Florida, they'll go through a series of critical moments.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Orion will jettison its boosters and other components, and the main engine will cut off and detach.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And then comes the exciting part, what's called trans-lunar injection, when a key part of Orion, built in Europe, what's known as ESA's service module, will power Orion away from Earth orbit and towards the moon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: At that point, the four crew will be allowed to take off their new orange, custom-made Orion flight suits that they wear for launch and reentry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: They're waterproof, fireproof and can keep the crew alive for six days if they suffer a loss of cabin pressure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: But let's be honest, they're not as comfy as some sweatpants and a t-shirt on a long journey.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: And it is a relatively long trip.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The four Artemis II astronauts will spend nine days and 13 hours flying 370,000 kilometres to the moon. Once they're there, they'll ease into orbit around the moon for a period of six days and expect some awesome photos as they cruise over the lunar surface and look back at Earth. The four astronauts, whose names are about to be announced, won't actually touch any moon rocks or come down here, at least this time, but they have an at Earth. The four astronauts, whose names are about to be announced, won't actually touch any moon rocks or come down here, at least this time, but they have an important role in testing out the systems for the next step, which comes as early as 2025, when the Artemis III mission will see astronauts landing on the south pole of the moon, the area that NASA has chosen as the best spot to set up a permanent lunar base.
